question: The new cost of living in New Mexico ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. — Prices are going up in New Mexico, especially at the grocery store. A recent study found the average New Mexican family is spending up to $286 on groceries per week – and even more when children are involved. According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, the average price for a pound of ground beef was $5.56 last month. That’s about 20 cents cheaper than back in July, but almost a full dollar more expensive than in January 2020 – right before the pandemic hit. It’s a similar trend for milk, but a gallon is only about 50 cents more expensive than four years ago. Eggs are half the price of what they were last winter, but that’s because there was an avian flu outbreak. Most produce items, like tomatoes and bananas, have stayed around the same price for several years now. That’s probably a good thing, because snacks are getting more expensive. Data shows the average bag of potato chips is almost $2 more expensive than four years ago. The price of chocolate chip cookies is also up almost 40%. All of those small increments add up. While it’s not likely there will be a major drop in grocery prices soon, there is some potentially good news when it comes to your housing budget. Officials with the Apartment Association of New Mexico say there are at least 40 housing projects under construction in the Albuquerque area. That is expected to bring at least 5,000 rental units to the market in the coming months. State leaders are pitching in too, with several new bills opening up millions of dollars in funding for even more housing projects. The average rent in Albuquerque is sitting at $1,340 a month – about $400 higher than in January 2020. Economists suggest an increased housing supply could reduce prices for everyone. There is also evidence that wage growth is happening. Data from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics showed average hourly earnings increased by 1.4% since last January. It’s worth noting wage growth rates have surpassed inflation rates since last February. /////// Paragraphs 1 through 3 indicate that

answers.text: some food items are now more expensive than they were before the pandemic
New Mexican families are now less numerous, therefore food provision is cheaper.
the consumption of beef and vegetables has increased, along with their prices
an avian flu outbreak is affecting the prices of milk and eggs nowadays.
popular snacks have had the smallest price increase in the last four years.

ual a forma correta de dizer 'Ela está estudando agora'?

answers.text: Have you ever been to England?
Did you ever go to England?

question: Complete a frase: 'If I had money, I ______ a new car.'

answers.text: Ela tem trabalhado desde a manhã.

Escolha a frase gramaticalmente correta:

answers.text: If I had known the answer, I would have told you.
If I knew the answer, I would have told you.
If I had known the answer, I would tell you.
If I have known the answer, I will tell you.
If I know the answer, I would have told you.

question: Complete com o verbo correto: 'She wishes she ______ how to drive.'

answers.text: O uso de 'don’t' está incorreto com 'He'

question: Complete a frase: 'She ______ her keys at home.'

question: Complete com a forma correta do verbo: 'If he ______ harder, he would pass the exam.'

answers.text: 'Who' é usado como sujeito e 'whom' como objeto
'Who' é usado como objeto e 'whom' como sujeito.

answers.text: He is used to working late
